intro: Ornithogalum stenopetalum var. grandiflorum, commonly known as the grandiflorum star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant features strap-like, grassy leaves and produces small, berry-like fruits that turn red as they mature. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its elegant appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
